Metadata: Taxonomy of economic seaweeds: with reference to some Pacific species, Volume VII
Results of an international workshop at Kasetsart University, Bangkok, Thailand, May 1997.

In this book, an international group of taxonomists representing the United States, Japan, China, Thailand, Chile, Korea, Vietnam, Malaysia, Australia, Mexico and Hong Kong describe the results of a workshop on the taxonomy of the genera "Sargassum", "Gelidium", "Gracilaria", and "Halymenia", new to this series.

The following papers are included in this proceedings: 1. Studies on the biserrulic "Sargassum" of China: II. The series "Coriifoliae" J. G. Agardh. C. K. Tseng and Lu Baoren pp. 3-22. 2. Preliminary report of "Sargassum" secies collected from Malaysian coasts. Tetsuro Ajisaka, et al. pp. 23-41. 3. Some new taxa of "Sargassum" (Phaeophyta) from Vietnam. Nguyen Huu Dinh and Huynh Quang Nang pp. 43-51. 4. Patterns of carposporangial production among species of "Gelidium" (Gelidales, Rhodophyta). Bernabe Santelices pp. 55-69. 5. Taxonomic status of the species originally ascribed to the Genus "Pterocladia" (Gelidiales, Rhodophyta). Bernabe Santelices pp. 71-80. 6. Taxonomic studies on "Pterocladiella​" (Gelidiaceae, Gelidiales, Rhodophyta) from China. Xia Bangmei and Wang Yongqian pp. 81-86. 7. On so-called "Gracilaria coronopifolia" from the Philippines and Japan. Hirotoshi Yamamoto, et al. pp. 89-97. 8. The species of "Gracilaria" from Vietnam. Masao Ohno, et al. pp. 99- 111. 9. The genera "Gracilaria" and "Gracilariopsis​" from Norfolk Island, Southwestern Pacific. Alan J. K. Millar and Xia Bangmei pp. 113-119. 10. Observations on an Adelphoparasite growing on "Gracilaria salicornia" from Thailand. Ryuta Terada, et al. pp. 131-129. 11. An adelphoparasite growing on "Gracilaria edulis" (Gracilariaceae rhodophyta) from Manado, Indonesia. Grevo S. Gerung, et al. pp. 131- 137. 12. A new record of "Gracilaria, G. Rubra" C.F. Chang et B.M. Xia from Thailand. Anong Chirapart and Rapeeporn Ruangchauy pp. 137-143. 13. Morphology and culture study of a red alga, "Halymenia dilatata zanardini", from Vietnam and Japan. S. Kawaguchi and K. Lewmanomont pp. 147-161. 14. Notes on some species of "Halymenia" in the southwestern Pacific. Isabella A. Abbott pp. 163-172. 15. Taxonomic studies on "Halymenia" (Halymeniaceae, Halymeniales, Rhodophyta) from China. Xia Bangmei and Wang Yongqian pp. 173-175.
